meanings.definition: Causing or tending to cause disruption.
meanings.sent1: The loud music was disruptive to my concentration.
meanings.sent2: The disruptive behavior of the students led to a chaotic classroom.
meanings.sent3: It was disruptive when the dog chased its tail during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The disruptive storm uprooted trees and scattered debris everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The disruptive noise of the construction work echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The disruptive child kept interrupting the teacher during the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The protest turned disruptive when some participants started breaking windows.
meanings.sent3: The disruptive squirrel stole all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: The disruptive force of the earthquake shook the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The disruptive technology revolutionized the way we communicate.

meanings.definition: Interrupting the normal course or unity of.
meanings.sent1: The disruptive phone call came in the middle of our important discussion.
meanings.sent2: The power outage was disruptive to the flow of the presentation.
meanings.sent3: It was disruptive when the cat knocked over the vase during the party.
meanings.sent4: The disruptive traffic jam delayed everyone's arrival to the event.
meanings.sent5: The disruptive schedule changes caused confusion among the team members.
